title: JSON-RPC Flow Schema
description: A schema for defining JSON-RPC workflows as a series of composable, nestable operations. Each flow consists of a sequence of steps that can be executed based on their data dependencies and control flow structures.

name.description: A unique identifier for the flow. Should be descriptive and follow kebab-case naming convention.

description.description: A detailed description of what the flow does, its purpose, and expected outcomes.

policies.description: Policies for the flow. The global policy applies to the workflow as whole. The step policy applies to the steps who do not have their own policy.

context.description: Optional global context variables available throughout the flow execution.

steps.description: An ordered sequence of steps to execute. While the order provides a visual guide, actual execution order is determined by data dependencies between steps.

Step.description: A single step in the flow. Each step must have exactly one of the primitive operations: request, transform, loop, or condition.

name.description: A unique identifier for the step within the flow. Used for referencing step results in expressions.

Policies.description: Optional policies for the step. If not provided, the default policies will be used.

retryPolicy.description: Optional retry policy. If not provided, the default retry policy will be used.

maxAttempts.description: The maximum number of attempts to retry the step. if the step type has a more specific maxAttempts, the default will be overridden, however, if set, it will override both the default and the step type specific maxAttempts. 0 means unlimited attempts (until timeout)

backoff.description: The backoff policy for the step. If not provided, the default backoff policy will be used.

strategy.description: The strategy to use for the backoff. If not provided, the default backoff strategy will be used.

retryableErrors.description: An array of error codes that are retryable.

timeout.description: Timeout policy. If not provided, the default timeout policy will be used.
Optional timeout for the step in milliseconds. If not provided, the default timeout will be used.

expressionEval.description: Optional timeout for expression evaluation in milliseconds. If not provided, the default expression timeout will be used.

RequestStep.description: A step that makes a JSON-RPC request. This is the primary mechanism for external interactions.

params.description: Parameters for the JSON-RPC method. Values can contain template expressions using ${...} syntax to reference other step results or context variables.

TransformStep.description: A step that performs data transformations using a series of operations.

input.description: Expression that evaluates to the input data for transformation.

operations.description: Sequence of operations to apply to the input data.

type.description: The type of transformation operation to perform.

using.description: Expression defining the operation. For map/filter, this is evaluated for each item. For reduce, this combines items.

as.description: Optional variable name for the current item in the operation expression.

LoopStep.description: A step that iterates over a collection and executes a nested step for each item.

over.description: Expression that evaluates to the array to iterate over.

as.description: Variable name to use for the current item in the iteration.

condition.description: Optional condition to determine whether to execute the step for each item.

maxIterations.description: Optional maximum number of iterations to perform.

step.description: The step to execute for each item in the iteration. Can be any primitive step type.

steps.description: An array of steps to execute for each item in the iteration.

ConditionStep.description: A step that conditionally executes one of two possible steps based on a condition.

if.description: Expression that evaluates to a boolean determining which step to execute.

then.description: Step to execute if the condition is true.

else.description: Optional step to execute if the condition is false.

StopStep.description: A step that signals to end the workflow, with options to end the entire workflow or just the current branch.

name.description: A unique identifier for the step within the flow. Used for referencing step results in expressions.

endWorkflow.description: Indicates whether to end the entire workflow (true) or just the current branch (false).
